module.name: ap239_work_definition
module.keywords: module work schedule plan scheme activity planning

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of work to be performed.
This module builds on application modules 10303-1306 (), 10303-1292 () and 10303-1283 () by adding:

ul.li: the capability to capture plans and schedules;
the association of resource and outputs with plans and schedules;
the association of a justification with a plan or schedule;
the control of work through requests and work orders;
the capability to describe the quantity and intended state of planned and actual resources at locations within a supply chain.

purpose.p: Plans and schedules are together known as schemes. Schemes may be associated with relevant meta-data such as by whom, when and why they were defined. Schemes may also have associated resources, linked either to the scheme as a whole or to a scheme entry

This application module also provides capability to identity the specific resources to be used on by an activity. It can also be used to describe the intended or required holdings of resources at any location within a supply chain. Information of the observed state of resource at a given location, and requests for the supply or movement of resources (supply chain transactions) are out of scope for this module.
This part of ISO 10303 uses the capabilities of the following significant modules
The AP239_product_definition_information module provides extensive capability to represent the product on which work will be done, both as a design and as a set of individuals.
The AP239_task_specification_resourced module provides the means to specify the work to be done, including the required resources.
The Resource_management_characterized module provides capability to characterize or classify managed resources, with information such as identifiers, dates, approvals, and justifications.
The Scheme module provides capability to represent plans and schedules.
The State_characterized module enables the characterization of state definitions and observed states. It is used to record information on the states of managed resources and activities.
The Activity_method_characterized module provides a means to characterize activity methods, task specifications and schemes.
The Activity_method_implementation module represents the data that is used to detail how an activity is to be performed. Activity methods may be implemented as task specifications or schemes.
The Justification module enables a justification to be related to a plan or schedule.

The
Work_order_characterized module provides further characterization and classification of a work order as defined by Application Module Work_order (10303-1043).

Work_request_characterized and the Work_output_characterized perform the same functions for a work request or a work output defined by Application Modules Work_request (10303-1042) and Work_output (10303-1300).

inscope.li: the plans and schedules for work to be performed;
the association of task specifications with plans and schedules;
the association of meta data with plans and schedules;
the association of resources and outputs with plans and schedules;
the location and quantification of planned and actual resources within a supply chain.

outscope.li: the recording of work done that corresponds to a plan or schedule;
the recording of resource usage that corresponds to a plan or schedule;
transactions requesting the supply or movement of resources.

aa.refpath_extend: characterized_definition -> characterized_object characterized_object => characterized_applied_action_assignment characterized_applied_action_assignment <= applied_action_assignment
